content: corner 4 in the single_crochet 3 together put 3 single_crochet together centered on the point to turn this corner blocking blocking is required for this project as you can see from the picture even with the larger hook size the strips tend to want to curl a light blocking will flatten that right out and allow you to correct for any gauge issues in each strip i used steam blocking for this project once you complete a monthly strip and added the border block the strip to the final dimensions before attaching it to the blanket © 2023 william sexton 5 chevron temperature blanket pattern joining strips once you have 2 strips you will need to join them together you can use any method you like to join your strips i have used the mattress stitch to join mine it creates a nice flat seam and is virtually invisible here is the video that i used to learn how to do the mattress stitch make sure and line up your days so that they flow nicely from on strip to the next with the mattress stitch join the new strip to the blanket matching up the first stitch of the long side of the two in the corner with the middle stitch of the 3 stitches in the point of the v if you have any issues with the days lining up count back from a day transition on both strips should be 5 for each day and start there blanket border note i haven t gotten to this part of pattern in my project this is preliminary perform the monthly strip border around the entire blanket for 2 or 3 row © 2023 william sexton 6 chevron temperature blanket pattern version history version description 1 original version 2 changed the number of single_crochet in the border point #3 from 4 to 3 improved the description on how to attach the strips together © 2023 william sexton 7
